channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Rights group slams 'rubber stamp' House for swift passage of Anti-Terror Bill
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: Former Chief Justice Maria Lourdes Sereno warned lawmakers that they must first answer questions on the people’s freedoms under the controversial Anti-Terrorism Bill, but her warning came in late.

item.title: DILG: Anti-Terror Bill will not be used to silence dissent
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: Interior Secretary Eduardo Año on Wednesday voiced his support for the Senate’s controversial bill seeking to bolster the country’s anti-terrorism policies.

item.title: House approves anti-terror bill on final reading despite backlash
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: A total of 173 congressmen voted to pass the measure, outnumbering 31 who voted negative and 29 others who abstained.

item.title: Palace, DFA told: Explain VFA withdrawal
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: It is unclear whether the government had been notified of the SC directive before Locsin announced Tuesday night that the Philippines has suspended the termination of VFA “in light of political and other developments” in the region.

item.title: Staff of courts outside Metro Manila want COVID-19 testing too
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: As courts nationwide resumed full operations on Monday, Judiciary personnel outside Metro Manila are asking that they be subjected to rapid testing for COVID-19 too.

item.title: PNP credits 'intensified mass testing' for recovery of cops with COVID-19
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: According to Police Gen. Archie Gamboa, the national police posted a 50.9% recovery rate with 176 out of the 346 recorded COVID-19 cases having recovered.

item.title: Don't sacrifice rights in fight vs terrorism, government told
item.description: “Why do our government officials always think law and order, peace and security can be realized only at the expense of our rights?”

item.title: Philippines reports 751 new COVID-19 infections, nearly 20,000 in total
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: (Update 1, 5:13 p.m.) More than 6.19 million cases of the coronavirus, including around 376,000 deaths, have been logged globally by the World Health Organization in its latest situation report.

item.title: Asian rights network sounds alarm on anti-terror bill
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: A network of 81 human rights organizations based in 21 Asian countries have collectively denounced the proposed "Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020."

item.title: Palace: Hiring jeepney drivers as contact tracers an option
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Roque said the government is also considering the complete reconfiguration of the jeepney to make it compliant with minimum health standards.
